lines.text: [Ted suggests temporarily becoming Regi's platonic roommate]
Well, I'm not *that* unconventional.
Aw, don't be old-fashioned. What are conventions anyway? Just a bunch of salesmen sitting around and telling stories.
It was lovely of you, but taking taxis when you haven't any money is a little foolish, isn't it?
Foolish? Why, I had to take a taxi. I couldn't go out in this pouring rain and get my only suit all wet, could I?
Where's your overcoat?
Ohhh, spending a little time in the pawnshop...
Well, why did you pawn your overcoat?
Why, to pay for the taxi, of course. Dope!
We're exactly alike.
No, ha ha, oh no, your hair is much prettier than...
marry for money.
Is that what you want to do?
Mm-hmm.
Oh, no, you're too nice for that.
Well, I don't want to spend the rest of my life working in a barber shop.
Well, but to go out in cold blood and deliberately marry somebody for money, that's no good.
Well, what are you doing?
I'm a heel!
Well, did I ever say I wasn't one?
Oh, father's living abroad. He has an amazing ability for borrowing money from practically total strangers. Unfortunately, that ability isn't hereditary.
How could the Drews be broke?
Well, do you remember that thing called the Crash?
Yes.
Well, that was us.
Yeah, and maybe here's that ten million dollars you've been dreaming about.
The way I feel today, I'd settle for a million.
You must have a lot of friends that could give you a job.
That'd be a fine friend who'd give you a job. No friend of mine had better try anything like that on me.
When a man's in love with a woman, he shouldn't keep it a secret.
Do you dream?
No.
You should - you'd meet a better class of people.

[Bumps into Regi while playing hopscotch]
I'm sorry. I didn't know the lights were against me.
It's alright.
[looks at him puzzled]
Hopscotch.
Hopscotch?
Mhmm. Indoor Hopscotch. Not up to field and turf hopscotch, but hopscotch never the less.
[hops more]
Get the idea?
Yes, I get the idea.
Want to play?
No thanks.
[walks toward elevator]
Well, every man to his own sport.
[keeps hopping, then stops and walks back toward the elevator too]
You'll be sorry when I am champion!
Stabbed in the cuticle; what a way to die.
I'm gunna tell my mother on you!
Go on; I'll tell my father on you!
I wonder what the poor people are doing on a day like this.
You can't blame me for wanting the things I do. Every woman wants them. Only I say I do.
Mother says I'm a throwback to my great-grandfather. He was a pirate.
Honest?
No, a pirate.
You know, you'd be very beautiful with blonde hair.
I have blonde hair.
You're almost as good at this as my mother was.
Was there anything else your mother did?
Mm-hmm... Before she turned out the lights, she always used to kiss me good night.
I'm only *almost* as good as your mother was.
